title: Is monogamy natural for humans🤔
description:

channel_info.description:
🎙Host of The Michael Sartain Podcast

transcription: {"text": "Monogamy is something that both people must work at every day. If one of the two people don't work at it, then it doesn't work because it's not the natural state of for humans. If it was the natural state, I don't have to work at eating French fries. I just see French fries and eat them. No one has to train me at no point in my life. Did I not like French fries at no point? Did someone have to put a gun to my head and said, Michael, you need to eat those carbs and that sugar. No one said that my natural proclivity is to put fat and carbs into my mouth. Evolution did not make for most people to be able to stay together for 75 years. The reason why we saw it so often is because our grandparents grew up during the period of the dust bowl, you needed lots of children in order to survive. If you lived in an agrarian society, you needed 14 kids because half of them.
